content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 10 to node 11 is:

9->7->4->3->11

Note that the path is represented as a sequence of nodes, where each node is followed by a slash (/). The path is traversed from node 10 to node 9, then from node 9 to node 7, from node 7 to node 4, from node 4 to node 3, and finally from node 3 to node 11.

The shortest path from node 10 to node 3 is:

7->4->3

Note that the path is represented as a sequence of nodes, where each node is followed by a slash (/). The path is traversed from node 10 to node 7, from node 7 to node 4, and finally from node 4 to node 3.
